column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=The invention relates to sustained-release matrices.
#Text=Most humans suffer from tooth decay and/or periodontal disease caused by bacteria in the mouth.
#Text=As a result, decreasing the number of bacteria in the mouth has long been the target of persons working in the health care field.
#Text=The most common way of minimizing the number of bacteria is to brush and floss the teeth regularly, and to visit a dental hygienist to have the teeth and gums cleaned thoroughly.
#Text=Another prior approach is oral rinsing, including with a solution containing a known anti-microbial agent like chlorhexidine digluconate.
#Text=After a toothbrush has been used, there are a large number of bacteria clinging to the bristles, even after the brush has been rinsed.
#Text=This, of course, is undesirable, and these bacteria typically will multiply on the bristles between uses.
#Text=To counter this problem, self-sterilizing toothbrushes have been described in the prior art.
#Text=One such self-sterilizing toothbrush is described by White et al., U.S.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=No. 2,216,333, and includes a combination of a water soluble salt (e.g., sodium carbonate) with an anti-microbial agent (e.g., sulfur).
#Text=The two are fused to a solid hard body and attached to the head of the toothbrush at the base of the bristles.
#Text=When exposed to water the sodium carbonate dissolves, forming an alkaline solution that in turn dissolves some sulfur, which kills bacteria.
#Text=Toothbrushes wear out with extended use.
#Text=Breuer et al., U.S.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=No. 4,802,255, describe a toothbrush that includes filaments that release a dye, and thus change color, in response to increased use of the filament.
#Text=The change in color provides a means for monitoring the degree of wear of the toothbrush.
#Text=Kent, U.S.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=No, 5,061,106, describes including capsules or microspheres in the tuft holes in which the bristles of a toothbrush are mounted.
#Text=The capsules or microspheres include a disinfectant or medicant that is released during use.
#Text=A dye may also be included in the structures.
#Text=The dye also is released over time to enable the user to become aware of when the contents of the capsules are depleted.
